joolyterdemo.functions module¶

Contains class that represents bundle of pre-built methods and properties for quick access

Classes:

  • Setup: Base class for one client and one connected vessel

impulse_maneuver(t_maneuver: int, dv_pro=0.0, dv_normal=0.0, dv_rad=0.0, lead_time=30) → bool¶

Commands KSP to perform specified burn with provided changes of velocity for instance connected :type:’krpc.types.Vessel’ vessel of instance of :class:’Setup’ setup

Parameters:

  • t_maneuver (int) – Start of burn in universal time in seconds

  • dv_pro (float, optional) – Change of velocity in prograde direction, defaults to 0.0

  • dv_normal (float, optional) – Change of velocity in normal direction, defaults to 0.0

  • dv_rad (float, optional) – Change of velocity in radial direction, defaults to 0.0

  • lead_time (int, optional) – Duration time warp[inactive] stops before burn in seconds, defaults to 30

Raises:

ValueError – Is raised if method is called too late

Returns:

True if burn is completely executed

Return type:

bool

property incl: float¶

Inclination of orbital plane of instance’s orbit relative to equatorial plane orbiting body

Returns:

Inclination in radians

Return type:

float

t_to_node(node='an') → int¶

Calculates time to absolute ascending [‘an’] or descending node [‘dn’]. Only works for Kerbin.

Parameters:

node (str) – Node to which time is calculated, defaults to ‘an’

Returns:

Time to specified node in seconds

Return type:

int

joolyterdemo.interpreter module¶

Contains logic to interpret user input for demo mission one and tow.

Functions:

  • one (dv12: float, dv23: float, dvtot: float, unit: str = “m/s”) -> bool: Returns True if mission was successful.

  • two(maneuver1: functions.ImpulseManeuver, maneuver2: functions.Maneuver, maneuver3: functions.Maneuver = None, unit = “m/s”) -> bool: Returns True if mission was successful.

class joolyterdemo.interpreter.Mission(name: str)¶

Bases: object

static one(dv12: float, dv23: float, unit: str = 'm/s') → bool¶

Commands KSP to perform burns with provided changes of velocity

Parameters:

  • dv12 (float) – Change of velocity to put vessel into transfer orbit

  • dv23 (float) – Change of velocity to put vessel into target orbit

  • unit (str, optional) – Unit of provided parameters, defaults to ‘m/s’

Raises:

ValueError – Is raised if wrong unit is given

Returns:

True if target orbit is reached (within margin)

Return type:

bool

static two(maneuver1: ImpulseManeuver, maneuver2: ImpulseManeuver, maneuver3: ImpulseManeuver | None = None) → bool¶

Commands KSP to perform specified types of maneuvers with provided changes of velocity in the given order.

Parameters:

  • maneuver1 (ImpulseManeuver) – First maneuver to perform

  • maneuver2 (ImpulseManeuver) – Second maneuver to perform

  • maneuver3 (ImpulseManeuver, optional) – Third maneuver to perform, defaults to None

Raises:

ValueError – Is raised if line of nodes does not coincide with apsides

Returns:

True if “kerbisynchronous” orbit is reached (within margin).

Return type:

bool

joolyterdemo.maneuver module¶

Contains classes for maneuver types.

Classes:

  • ImpulseManeuver: Base class - not supposed to be called. Contains general information for maneuver and function to compute directional dv.

  • VelocityChange (BaseClass): Represents maneuver in orbital plane changing only orbital velocity.

  • InclinationChange (BaseClass): Represents maneuver changing inclination w/o changes of orbital velocity.

  • Combined (BaseClass): Represents maneuver changing inclination of orbital plane and orbital velocity.

class joolyterdemo.maneuver.CombinedManeuver(dv: float, v1: float, v2: float, unit: str = 'm/s')¶

Bases: ImpulseManeuver

Representing combined maneuvers changing inclination and velocity

Parameters:

  • dv (float) – Change in velocity for maneuver

  • v1 (float) – Orbital velocity before maneuver

  • v2 (float) – Orbital velocity after maneuver

  • unit (str, optional) – Unit of provided velocity values, defaults to ‘m/s’

Raises:

ValueError – Is raised if unit is not “m/s” or “km/s”

class joolyterdemo.maneuver.ImpulseManeuver(dv: float, unit: str = 'm/s')¶

Bases: object

Base class for different maneuver types. Not supposed to be called directly.

Parameters:

  • dv (float) – Change in velocity for maneuver

  • unit (str, optional) – Unit of provided velocity values, defaults to “m/s”

Raises:

ValueError – Is raised if unit is not “m/s” or “km/s”

direct_dv() → Tuple[float, float, float]¶

Computes directional dv as tuple from class instance’s dv and _burn_angle

Returns:

dv in 3D-tuple: (dv_radial, dv_prograde, dv_normal)

Return type:

Tuple[float, float, float]

invert_burn_angle() → None¶

Inverts private field _burn_angle

class joolyterdemo.maneuver.InclinationChangeManeuver(dv: float, v: float, unit: str = 'm/s')¶

Bases: ImpulseManeuver

Representing maneuvers only changing inclination / without energetic change.

Parameters:

  • dv (float) – Change in velocity for maneuver

  • v (float) – Orbital velocity at maneuver

  • unit (str, optional) – Unit of provided velocity values, defaults to ‘m/s’

Raises:

ValueError – Is raised if unit is not “m/s” or “km/s”

Representing in orbital plane maneuvers / solely energetic change

  • dv (float) – Change in velocity for maneuver

  • unit (str, optional) – Unit of provided velocity values, defaults to “m/s”
